title.value: V-STaR: Training Verifiers for Self-Taught Reasoners
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated on the first page of the research paper.
title.quote: V-STaR: Training Verifiers for Self-Taught Reasoners

extractions.description: The paper introduces V-STaR (Verification for Self-Taught Reasoners), a method that leverages both correct and incorrect solutions generated by Large Language Models (LLMs) during self-improvement processes to train a verifier for ranking the correctness of solutions. This approach improves the reasoning abilities of LLMs, achieving significant accuracy gains in benchmarks for code generation and mathematical reasoning tasks.

type.justification: The paper provides empirical evaluations and results demonstrating the effectiveness of V-STaR over existing methods on code generation and math reasoning benchmarks.
type.quote: We empirically evaluate V-STaR on math reasoning using GSM8K (Cobbe et al., 2021) and a subset of MATH (Hendrycks et al., 2021), and on code-generation using MBPP (Austin et al., 2021) and HumanEval (Chen et al., 2021).

name.justification: The research focuses on improving the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) through self-improvement and verification techniques, which are core areas of Deep Learning.
name.quote: Common self-improvement approaches for large language models (LLMs), such as STaR (Zelikman et al., 2022), iteratively fine-tune LLMs on self-generated solutions to improve their problem-solving ability.

name.justification: The paper primarily deals with enhancing the reasoning capabilities of LLMs through iterative self-improvement and verification.
name.quote: To address this shortcoming, we propose V-STaR that utilizes both the correct and incorrect solutions generated during the self-improvement process to train a verifier using DPO that judges correctness of model-generated solutions.

name.justification: The paper fine-tunes LLaMA2 models for comparisons and evaluations in both math reasoning and code generation tasks.
name.quote: Fine-tuning LLaMA2 (Touvron et al., 2023) and CodeLLaMA (Rozière et al., 2023), we compare V-STaR to other self-improvement and verification-based methods.

name.justification: The paper fine-tunes CodeLLaMA models for comparisons and evaluations in both math reasoning and code generation tasks.
